description: Pilates is an exercise program designed to stretch, strengthen, and balance the body. The poses are systematic and utilise specific breathing techniques that make them extremely effective in encouraging muscle tone. Pilates has been used by dancers and sports professional but is suitable for persons interested in improving overall fitness. Benefits of Pilates include: increased lung capacity, flexibility, improved posture and balance, back strength and muscular definition particularly in the abdominal region. Practitioner Suzanne Deason discusses the theory that excess body weight may reflect a lifestyle imbalance, addressed through Pilates, which aims to bring harmony between mind, body and spirit. Part one: Creating awareness. Covers several poses and breathing techniques that bring awareness to isolating and moving different parts of the body. Helps strengthen abdominal, leg and arm muscles. Part two: Workout focusing on increased circulation, flexibility and strength for the entire body. Poses include: Foot and ankle work; Leg circles; Single and double leg stretch; Hip circles; Gentle spine twist; Spine stretch; Lower-body leg lifts; Hamstring stretch; Side leg lifts and circles; and Inner thigh lifts. Three levels are displayed to accommodate various levels of fitness - for an explanation of the levels view section one; workouts narrated with detailed instructions. To reduce the risk of injury, consult your doctor before beginning this or any exercise program.
